stanford.androidlib.graphics

Class GOval

  • java.lang.Object
    • stanford.androidlib.graphics.GObject
      • stanford.androidlib.graphics.GOval
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GFillable, GResizable, GScalable

    public class GOval
extends GObject
implements GFillable, GResizable, GScalable
    The GOval class is a graphical object whose appearance consists of an oval.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GOval()
      Constructs a new 0x0 oval, positioned at the origin.
      GOval(float width, float height)
      Constructs a new oval with the specified width and height, positioned at the origin.
      GOval(float x, float y, float width, float height)
      Constructs a new oval with the specified bounds.
      GOval(GCanvas canvas)
      Constructs a new 0x0 oval, positioned at the origin.
      GOval(GCanvas canvas, float width, float height)
      Constructs a new oval with the specified width and height, positioned at the origin.
      GOval(GCanvas canvas, float x, float y, float width, float height)
      Constructs a new oval with the specified bounds.

      • GOval

        public GOval(float width,
             float height)
        Constructs a new oval with the specified width and height, positioned at the origin.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the oval in pixels
        height - The height of the oval in pixels
        Usage:
        GOval goval = new GOval(width, height);

      • GOval

        public GOval(float x,
             float y,
             float width,
             float height)
        Constructs a new oval with the specified bounds.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the upper left corner
        y - The y-coordinate of the upper left corner
        width - The width of the oval in pixels
        height - The height of the oval in pixels
        Usage:
        GOval goval = new GOval(x, y, width, height);
